I cannot predict the future, but i can provide insights based on data.

the cannabis industry has been growing rapidly in recent years, and the trend is expected to continue as more states legalize marijuana for medical and/or recreational use. according to some reports, the legal cannabis industry in the us could be worth $35 billion by 2025.

as more states move to legalize marijuana, it becomes easier for researchers to study its effects and for companies to invest in the industry. this increased investment and research could lead to innovations in cannabis-based products and create new job opportunities in the industry.

however, challenges such as inconsistent regulations, federal restrictions, and social stigma could slow down the growth of the cannabis industry in some areas. additionally, the ongoing covid-19 pandemic could also affect the industry's growth as it has impacted many businesses and industries worldwide.

overall, the growth of the cannabis industry in the future will depend on several factors, including legal and regulatory changes, public perception, and economic conditions.
